description: Change of use of basement and ground floor levels from Professional Services (Use Class A2) to Dance Studio (Use Class D1) with ancillary shop (Use Class A1); change of use of first and second floors from Offices (Use Class B1a) to Residential (Use Class C3) to accommodate two self-contained residential units (2x2 bed); extension to existing basement; part single, part three storey rear extensions (with associated first floor terrace); rear roof extension with associated roof terrace and installation of three rooflights to front roofslope with associated cycle parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: SV(0)102 - OS Map & Block Plan, SV/103 - Survey Site Plan, SV/104 - Survey Basement Floor Plan, SV/105 - Survey Ground Floor Plan, SV/106 - Survey First Floor Plan, SV/107 - Survey Second Floor Plan, SV/108 - Survey Roof Space Plan, SV/109 - Survey Front Elevations, SV/110 - Survey Rear Elevations, SV/111 - Survey Section AA, PA/201 - Proposed Site Plan, PA/202 - Proposed Basement Floor Plan, PA/203 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, PA/204 (Rev. A) - Proposed First Floor Plan, PA/205 - Proposed Second Floor Plan, PA/206 - Proposed Loft Plan, PA/207 - Proposed Front Elevation, PA/208 - Proposed Rear Elevation, PA/209 (Rev. A) - Proposed Detailed Section AA, PA/210 - Proposed Detailed Section BB, Design & Access Statement prepared by AT Design (dated December 2019), Construction Management Plan prepared by AT Design (dated November 2019), Environmental Noise Report prepared by Azymuth Acoustics (dated 5th December 2019), Daylight & Sunlight Report prepared by Energy Council (dated 29th November 2019)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with the approved drawings and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16. | Cycle parking for 4 no. bicycles shall be implemented, as per the approved drawings, in a secure and lockable compound, prior to first occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage and disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be installed in accordance with the Council's criteria stated in SPG10 and ensure that the noise standards specified in BS8233:2014 will be met for internal rooms and external amenity areas. Acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed if necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building). Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | An enhanced sound/vibration insulation is recommended between the Dance Studio and adjacent/adjoining habitable rooms and businesses. The Dance Studio noise assessment requires noise rating levels to indicate peak noise from various studio activities at specific frequencies:

A precise sound insulation calculation, using the worst case one-hour data (octave band linear noise spectra from 63 Hz - 4k Hz) by night and day, to arrive at the minimum sound reductions necessary to meet the SPG10 internal data.

Compliance with the internal and external criteria set by SPG10 will require approval by means of a post-completion test, to be carried out the developer, and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The 2 no. car parking bays to the rear of the site shall be restricted to use by employees of the approved dance studio only, and not by other individuals.

Reason: To maintain an emphasis on delivering a car free scheme, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | The use permitted shall not operate outside 06:00hrs and 22:00hrs Monday to Friday, 08:00hrs and 22:00hrs on Saturday and 09:00 hours to 19:00 hours on Sundays; and Deliveries/ refuse collection shall only be permitted between 07:00hrs and 20:00hrs.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7A of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 3.1 (c) and 3.8 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended by the Town and country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the premises shall only be used under the D1 Use Class (with ancillary A1) and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard Strategic Industrial and Employment Land in accordance with policies 4A, 7A, 7.4, 7B and 6.13 of the Development Management DPD adopted 10 December 2013, policy 3.2 of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 6.1 of the London Plan (2016).
